subject: Leadership
title: Psychological Safety
description: A quick, practical guide to Psychological Safety.

hook.text: Google studied hundreds of teams to find what makes the best ones work. The answer? Psychological safety.

buildup.text: Psychological safety means people feel safe to take risks, speak up, and make mistakes without fear of punishment.

discovery.text: Amy Edmondson's research showed that teams with high psychological safety learn faster and innovate more.

twist.text: It's not about being nice. It's about being honest. Safe teams have more conflict, not lessâ€”but it's productive.

climax.text: Leaders create safety by responding well to bad news, asking questions, and framing failure as learning.

punchline.text: When people feel safe to fail, they're brave enough to succeed.
